Summary: The Aloft Beijing Haidian is a modern and stylish hotel with clean rooms, located in the Haidian district, a bit removed from central Beijing. It offers amenities like a small gym, a pool table, and internet access.

The Ascott Beijing offers spacious apartments with fully equipped kitchens and laundry facilities, providing a home-away-from-home experience. It includes amenities like a pool, gym, and in-room massage services.

The Autumn Garden Hotel is located in a traditional hutong (maze of alleyways), offering a quiet escape from the busy city with a courtyard and a feel for old China. It is a short walk to Tiananmen Square and provides a tricycle service to the main road.
The Bamboo Garden Hotel is located in a hutong, offering a quiet and peaceful environment with gardens and courtyards. Rooms feature Chinese-style decor, and some have views of the gardens.
Century Towers Beijing offers apartment-style rooms with full kitchens, dining rooms, and washer/dryers. The rooms are spacious and air-conditioned and have flat-screen TVs with cable.
The hotel has a coffee shop in an older part of the building with lots of character and a lobby bar. Rooms on the higher floors offer distant views of Beijing through the smog.

The Far East Hotel is located in a traditional hutong neighborhood, offering a glimpse into everyday Chinese life away from commercial areas. The hotel is situated in a busy Hutong full of things to eat and buy and close to the main Beijing sights.

The Friendship Hotel is a large complex with multiple buildings set in a garden-like area, offering a peaceful environment away from the chaotic city. It features traditional Beijing-style buildings and well-maintained gardens, creating an "island of tranquility."
The Guangming hotel is a recently remodeled, modern hotel with hi-tech decor and LCD TVs with international channels. The lobby is clean and 5-star-ish.

The Beijing Hotel has a history dating back over 100 years, with older sections of the hotel offering a glimpse into 1950s/60s communist-era China with decor from that period. The hotel consists of multiple buildings with different styles, with some reviewers describing a feeling of stepping back in time when exploring the older sections.
The Beijing International Hotel has a revolving restaurant on the 28th floor with city views. The spacious foyer is glorious and the hotel is centrally located.

The Jade Youth Hostel is located in a quiet alley near the Forbidden City and WanfangJie shopping street, offering affordable rooms with amenities like cozy duvets, cable TV, and free Wi-Fi in the lobby. The hostel provides a traditional-style breakfast area and reading room, and offers the chance to try on Emperor/Empress suits for photos.

Sihe Hotel is located in a traditional hutong neighborhood, offering a quiet courtyard setting with traditionally furnished rooms. The hotel is noted for its peaceful atmosphere and unique cultural experience, contrasting with larger, more modern hotels.

The Radegast is described as a modern and luxurious hotel with spacious, well-appointed rooms, modernized lighting systems, electric curtains, and impressive bathrooms (some with TVs). The hotel has an awesome pool, a spa, and multiple restaurants offering various cuisines.

The Capital Hotel has a large lobby with statuettes, a live fish tank, a bowling alley, pool, spa, and multiple restaurants, but is often described as empty and depressing with few people around. Some reviewers also noted the hotel's grand, Soviet-style architecture.

The China World Hotel has a grand and opulent lobby with live music, and luxurious rooms with comfortable beds and marble bathrooms, providing a comfortable experience. The hotel also has a health club with a pool, sauna, and oxygen room.
The City Hotel is centrally located in Beijing, close to bars and the subway. Some rooms are apartment-style with multiple beds, but may be in shabby condition and lack cooking utensils.

The Commune by the Great Wall is a collection of architect-designed villas spread along a valley next to the Great Wall, offering a private section of the Wall for guests and a peaceful atmosphere away from Beijing. The hotel provides car service between the villas and main facilities due to the scattered layout.

Courtyard 7 is a renovated courtyard hotel in Beijing's old hutong area, offering a peaceful escape with traditional furnishings and courtyards, located off Nanluoguxiang street with its shops and restaurants. Some rooms feature private courtyards, and the hotel's courtyards have trees and lanterns, creating a calming and romantic atmosphere.

The Courtyard Beijing is connected to the New World Shopping Center with a grocery store, food court, and other shops, and is near subway and train stations, offering convenient access to tourist sites. Some found it to be a safe haven and quiet refuge from the busy metropolis of Beijing.

The hotel is modern, sleek, and eloquently designed with comfortable, immaculate, and spacious rooms, flat-screen TVs with English channels, and ultramodern bathrooms; the hotel also has a modern gym, lap pool and hot tub. The hotel is conveniently located about 20 minutes from the airport by cab.

The Crowne Plaza Beijing is described as a quiet refuge from the bustle of the huge city, with large and well-decorated rooms. The hotel has a stunning atrium and is located on Wangfujing Street, close to major tourist sites.
The hotel lobby has a fresh, softly scented air and the rooms are silent. The hotel has a spa, a warm pool, and a club lounge.

The Crowne Plaza Beijing International Airport Hotel is described as clean, quiet, and modern, with spacious, well-equipped rooms and multiple bars and lounges. It is located in an industrial area, away from the city center.

The Crowne Plaza Wuzhou is located near the Olympic Park, away from the city center, with quiet surroundings as shops and restaurants close early. The hotel has a gym and a pool, and offers various dining options including a Brazilian restaurant.

The Crowne Plaza Sun Palace Hotel is a new, luxurious hotel with spacious rooms and comfortable beds, featuring a spa with a swimming pool and saunas. Although located in an area with ongoing construction, it is a short walk to the subway and offers a quiet escape with high-quality amenities.

The hotel is located in a courtyard off the main road, offering a quiet environment, and some rooms have views over the adjoining Hutong. There is also a charming little park next to the hotel that connects two roads, which is lovely for a stroll.

The hotel has a modern feel, with clean white duvet coverings, flat-screen TVs, and showers with hot water; however, some found that it didn't feel Chinese and could have been in Tucson. It is located on a busy business street, which some found desolate at night, and is not near an underground station.

The Double Happiness Courtyard Hotel is a traditional Chinese courtyard hotel located in a hutong (alleyway), featuring carved wooden furniture, silk bedspreads, and courtyards with lanterns and tinkling fountains. The hotel's rooms are decorated in a traditional Chinese style, and the hotel is located in a residential area with local restaurants and shops nearby.

The Doubletree Hilton Beijing offers modern, spacious rooms with fine decor and facilities, including a rooftop garden with a swimming pool and health spa, providing a comfortable and luxurious environment. The hotel's grand entrance, friendly staff, and excellent service contribute to a pleasant and memorable stay.
The Empark Grand Hotel has an underground "city" with restaurants, boutiques, spas, and a gym/pool. The hotel is located in the northwest part of the city, a taxi ride away from attractions.

Fujian Hotel is described as a standard 4-star hotel with a mix of Chinese and Western guests, offering amenities such as free Wi-Fi, free bottled water, and a breakfast buffet with both Chinese and Western options. The hotel is conveniently located near the 3rd ring road, about 20-30 minutes from the airport.
The Gloria Plaza Hotel has a grand, spacious entrance and lounge area, with large picture windows offering views of the busy city. It also has a fitness studio, swimming pool, and beauty salon.

The Grand Hotel is described as a traditional hotel with spacious rooms and a luxurious feel, located within walking distance of major tourist spots like the Forbidden City and Tiananmen Square. It features an indoor atrium with live music and a fountain bar.

The Grand Hyatt Beijing boasts an amazing indoor pool decorated like a tropical forest with simulated stars overhead, offering a unique and relaxing escape. Its location above a large upscale mall and close proximity to major sites like the Forbidden City and Tiananmen Square also provide a convenient and immersive experience.

The Grand Mercure Hotel Xidan Beijing is described as an "oasis" with a beautiful lobby featuring pottery, glasswork, an aquarium, and a lounge with a bar, offering a refreshing escape after a busy day in the city. It also features a pool, spa, sauna, and fitness center.

The Grand Millennium Hotel boasts modern decor, spacious and luxurious rooms with large bathrooms, and a huge indoor swimming pool. Its location outside the inner city near a subway station provides a convenient escape with easy access to the city.

The Grand View Garden Hotel has a classical Chinese architectural style and provides access to a large garden based on the Chinese classic "The Dream of the Red Mansion." Some reviewers noted the hotel's distance from the city center and attractions.

I am sorry, but none of the reviews describe this hotel as an "escape from reality." Most reviews focus on its location, cleanliness, and service quality, and mention that it is close to shops, restaurants, and attractions like Tiananmen Square and the Forbidden City.
I am sorry, but the reviews indicate that this hotel is a basic, budget hotel. It is clean and well-located, but does not stand out in a way that would make it feel like an escape from reality.

The Hebei Guest House is a courtyard hotel located in a traditional Hutong neighborhood, offering an authentic feel of old Beijing. It is situated away from traffic and construction noise, within walking distance of attractions like the Forbidden City and Tiananmen Square.
The Hilton Beijing offers a comfortable stay with modern amenities, newly refurbished rooms, and an executive lounge. It has a gym with squash courts, an indoor pool, and attentive staff.

The Hilton Beijing Wangfujing offers large, modern rooms with high-tech amenities like electronic curtains, rain showers, and video screens in the bathroom, providing a luxurious and comfortable stay. Its central location near Wangfujing Street, the Forbidden City, and Tiananmen Square allows for easy access to the city's attractions.

The Holiday Inn Lido offers a variety of amenities including restaurants, shops, a bowling alley, and a post office, creating a self-contained environment. Some reviewers note the hotel's older furnishings and distance from the city center, contributing to a sense of being removed from the main attractions of Beijing.

The Holiday Inn Central Plaza offers a quiet retreat with spacious, modern rooms, a pool, gym, and easy taxi access to the city, though it is located outside the center in a residential neighborhood. Some reviewers note it feels like an oasis, contrasting with the busy city.

The Holiday Inn Chang An West in Beijing is located on the west side of the city, a bit far from downtown, but near a subway station; the hotel offers amenities such as a gym, pool, and executive lounge with free food and drinks. Some reviewers mention the hotel's rooms, especially on the executive floors, are comparable to a 5-star hotel and offer amenities such as free laundry service and access to an executive lounge.
The hotel has a swimming pool, spa, and beauty salon and is located close to a subway stop. It is near a supermarket and a market.

The hotel is near the Ethnic Minority People's Park, described as a mini-Epcot, and a mosque converted into an outlet mall. It is located in a more traditional Chinese area, away from tourists, and has an outdoor breakfast area with a pond.

The Holiday Inn Express Temple of Heaven is located in a quiet residential area, away from the touristy parts of town, but with easy access to taxis. The rooms are clean, modern, and comfortable, providing a good night's sleep.
The Holiday Inn Express Wangjing is a new, modern hotel located next to the Hua Tang Shopping Center. The hotel rooms have flat-screen TVs, and the hotel offers free internet and breakfast.

The Holiday Inn Temple of Heaven is located in a normal residential area of Beijing, away from the main tourist areas, with a grocery store across the street. The hotel has a KTV karaoke lounge and a heated pool, and is about a 10-15 minute walk to the nearest subway station and Temple of Heaven park.

The hotel is located at the end of a street with major construction, and the walls are thin, making it easy to hear neighbors. It caters less to Westerners, with limited English-speaking staff and a repetitive breakfast.

Hotel Cote Cour SL is located in a quiet hutong in the center of Beijing, offering a respite from the bustling city. Once inside the red front door, guests find a different world away from the dusty, noisy streets.

Hotel G is a hip boutique hotel with a bohemian European chic style, trendy interior design, and colorful window lighting that guests can control. The hotel aims to provide a comfortable and personalized experience, making guests feel at home and offering an escape from the polluted city.

Ibis Sanyuan Hotel is located in Phoenix City, near the Sanyuanqiao subway station and the airport express train, providing convenient access to the city and airport. The hotel is situated in a developing area with ongoing construction.
The hotel has a revolving restaurant on the top floor and executive level rooms that are renovated and come with a butler. Rooms have spacious bathrooms, some with LCD screens and city views.

The New Otani Chang Fu Gong Hotel has a Japanese garden, swimming pool, indoor tennis/basket/volleyball courts, and a luxury day-spa with a beauty salon. The hotel also has Japanese bath facilities, soaking tubs, and saunas.

The Howard Johnson Paragon features an atrium breakfast area that gives the feeling of being outdoors, and is connected to a shopping mall with a supermarket. Some rooms offer views of an inner courtyard.
I am sorry, but the provided reviews do not contain information that would be helpful in determining if this hotel feels like an escape from reality.

The Hua Wei Business Appartment Hotel is located in a busy shopping district and occupies the 9th-11th floors of a department store, offering a less touristy experience. The hotel is situated in a lively area that quiets down at night, with rooms facing a courtyard for added tranquility.

The Intercontinental Beijing Beichen is located in the Olympic Stadium area, offering a sense of space and quiet that is rare in Beijing, with views of the Olympic Green, Bird's Nest, and Water Cube. The hotel has modern, upscale furnishings and is somewhat removed from the city center, requiring taxi or subway rides to reach downtown areas.

The Intercontinental Beijing Financial Street offers a luxurious and modern escape with spacious, well-appointed rooms, a great spa, and a health club with a large pool and hot tub. Its location in the financial district provides a quiet oasis from the city's bustle, while still being a short taxi ride away from major attractions.

The Jade Garden Hotel has an interesting history, having served as a guesthouse during the Long March and later as a headquarters for Communist leaders. It was completely redone for the Beijing Olympics.

The hotel has a garden view with a small terrace overlooking a fish pond and trees, creating a different world from the streets outside. It also features an indoor swimming pool, sauna, and a lobby cafe serving fresh loose leaf teas.

The Qianmen Hotel has a Beijing Opera theme, with operas performed nightly in its in-house theatre, and is located in a regular Chinese neighborhood a bit out of the tourist zone. The hotel is near a supermarket and a short taxi ride to major attractions.

Jinqiao Hotel Apartments offers apartment-style rooms with kitchens and amenities like a washing machine. The ground floor has various businesses, including a restaurant with a "Western" theme featuring staff dressed in cowboy attire.

Joy City Hotel Beijing offers spacious rooms and suites with amenities like kitchenettes, HDTVs, and free internet access. It is connected to the Joy City Shopping Mall, providing access to dining and shopping options.

The JW Marriott Beijing has modern, spacious rooms with features like flat-screen TVs in the bathroom, Bose sound systems, and electronic blinds. Some reviewers mention the hotel's spa, gym, and pool area as being particularly well-designed and relaxing.

Hotel Kapok is a modern, boutique hotel with a unique design, including glass-walled bathrooms with curtains for privacy, and courtyard rooms with pebble/flower gardens inside. It is located near the Forbidden City and Wangfujing shopping area, offering a quiet retreat from the city's activity.

Kelly's Courtyard is a 9-room accommodation located in a hutong area, featuring a glass-covered courtyard, a rooftop terrace, and a mezzanine lounge, with jazzy ambient music played throughout the day. It is situated away from the main tourist areas, offering a feel for ordinary Beijing life, and is accessible via a walk down alleys.

The hotel has multiple restaurants offering diverse cuisines (Cantonese BBQ, German, Chinese, Japanese, Italian), a German-style Paulaner beer garden, and is connected to the Lufthansa Shopping Centre. It is described as a "city within a city" and a place where one might not need to leave the complex.

The Kuntai Royal Hotel offers plush rooms with comfortable beds, excellent bathrooms featuring separate showers and tubs, and a nice pool/gym area. Some reviewers mention the health spa area, and the availability of in-room massages.

Lee Gardens Service Apartment offers spacious apartments with kitchens, laundry machines, and access to a gym and pool, located near shopping areas and attractions like the Forbidden City. Some reviewers note the property could use renovation.

The Legendale Hotel in Beijing is designed in a French classic style, with spacious rooms and large bathrooms stocked with Loccitane amenities. It features an indoor pool resembling an antique Roman pool, a health club with jacuzzies, and is located near shopping centers and dining options.

The Loong Palace is a gorgeous hotel and resort with fantastic facilities, located outside of the city, where the Great Wall is visible on a clear day; it has amenities such as indoor tennis courts, a bowling alley, a recreation center/gymnasium, a pool, and a spa. It is far from the city center, described as being in the middle of nowhere and outside the 5th ring highway.

The Luxury Serviced Residence offers spacious apartments with separate living areas, full kitchens, and multiple bathrooms, creating a home-like environment with amenities like a 24-hour convenience store nearby. The loft-style apartments and inclusion of facilities like a laundrette and gym provide a self-contained and comfortable living space.

The Marco Polo Parkside Hotel has spacious, quiet rooms and luxurious bathrooms, with some rooms featuring a glass wall between the bathroom and bedroom. It is located a bit outside the city center, near the Olympic Park, offering a quieter environment, and has a spa.
The Beijing Marriott West offers very large rooms and suites, some with jacuzzi tubs, and an executive lounge. Its location on the west side of the city is a bit removed from the main tourist areas.

The Marriott Executive Apartments Beijing is a new hotel featuring spacious 2-bedroom apartments with fully equipped kitchens, home cinema systems, and access to amenities like a swimming pool, gym, sauna, and steam room. While located in the Chaoyang district on the outskirts of the city, it offers a comfortable and roomy environment with easy access to attractions via taxi or metro.

The hotel is newly constructed with luxurious, spacious rooms and a world-class spa featuring private rooms with rose petals, candles, and aromatherapy oils. It is located near a park with remnants of the city wall.

The Mercure Wanshang is located away from the noise of Beijing streets, near the "ring five" highway, and a 5-10 minute walk from the subway; it features a gym, pool, and spa. Rooms are large with comfortable beds.

Michael's House is a small, cozy courtyard hotel in a traditional hutong neighborhood, offering a unique cultural experience away from touristy areas. The hotel features traditionally decorated rooms, a comfortable courtyard lounge, and friendly staff who can assist with travel arrangements and provide a more personal touch than larger hotels.

Motel 268 Wangfujing is located near the Wangfujing shopping area and night food market, and within walking distance of the Forbidden City. Rooms range in quality, with basic windowless options and nicer rooms available, and feature soundproof windows.
The New World Hotel has a newly refurbished lobby, dining facilities, and executive floors with modern rooms and LCD TVs. Some rooms offer a view of the city and the CCTV building.

The Nikko New Century Beijing has a large marbled lobby, and some reviewers found the common areas superb, but the hotel's decor is dated with light colored wood panels reminiscent of the early 90's. The hotel is located near the Panda Zoo and Purple Bamboo Park, a 10-15 minute taxi ride from the Old Quarter.

The hotel has a tranquil and luxurious environment, an infinity-like pool, and offers western tradition while showcasing Chinese culture. Some rooms have views of the Forbidden City and are spacious with floor-to-ceiling windows offering views over the rooftops of Beijing.

The Novotel Xin Qiao is described as a standard Novotel, with some older rooms that may have a musty smell or overlook run-down areas, though some rooms are renovated with modern fixtures. Some reviewers found it depressing, with a roadside motel feel, while others enjoyed executive floor amenities.

The Oakwood Residence Beijing offers large, comfortable apartments with fully equipped kitchens and laundry facilities, providing a home-like environment for longer stays. It is located near shopping malls and restaurants, but not within walking distance of landmarks, and features a pool, gym, and spa.

The Orange Hotel provides a modern, clean environment with unique touches like complimentary evening snacks and a pet goldfish in each room. It is conveniently located near the subway and within walking distance of the Olympic stadium.

The Oriental Bay International Hotel has a magnificent lobby and spacious, clean rooms with nice decor. There is an indoor pool, fitness center, and restaurants, including one on the top floor with city views.

The Beijing Oriental Culture Hotel features a lobby with a fountain, piano, and palm trees, as well as facilities like a swimming pool, gym, bowling alley, and snooker rooms. Rooms have widescreen TVs with movies in English or with subtitles.

The Oriental Garden boasts a garden complex next door that is free to hotel guests and is used by locals for early morning exercises. The hotel has a unique "Old World" ambience with dark wood decor, and a shopping arcade selling local items.

The Marriott Palm Springs offers spacious apartments within a secure, gated complex with extensively landscaped grounds, a waterfall, and a childrenâ€™s play structure. Guests have access to an athletic club with a workout room and a luxurious indoor pool, creating a private and secure environment.

Located on the top floors of a skyscraper, Park Hyatt Beijing offers stunning views of the city. The rooms are modern and sleek, with features like spa-style bathrooms and high-tech Japanese toilets, with some reviewers describing it as a serene and comfortable experience.

The Park Plaza Beijing Wangfujing is described as a modern and stylish hotel that is set back from the main street, offering a quiet and soothing atmosphere. Some reviewers mention the absence of a pool.
The Peixin Hotel is owned and run by the police department and is a 10-15 minute taxi ride away from Tiananmen Square. It features rooms with free internet access, and is listed as a "Green Hotel".

The Plaza Hotel offers modern, clean rooms with views of Beijing's ring roads and traffic, providing a glimpse into a rapidly changing city. It is located away from the city center, near local markets and disappearing hutongs, offering a different perspective on Beijing.

The Prime Hotel offers comfortable rooms with features such as comfortable beds, spacious rooms, and large desks that provide a great escape from the noisy streets of Beijing. The hotel is centrally located, offering convenient access to the main attractions, shopping streets, and old hutongs, while still maintaining a safe and quiet atmosphere.

The hotel is a brand new, chic design hotel with spacious rooms, modern bathrooms, and comfortable beds, featuring amenities like a pool, spa, gym, and executive lounge. Although located a bit outside the city center, it's near a metro station and a shopping mall, offering a convenient escape with excellent service.

The Qianyuan Hotel has interesting design features such as glass bathroom enclosures and carpets in the elevators that display the day of the week. Rooms have safes, and the hotel is located on a busy street near restaurants and subway stations.

The Raffles Beijing, located near Tiananmen Square and the Forbidden City, features spacious, luxurious rooms and is connected to indoor offices and shopping. Some reviewers mention it as a tranquil retreat and an oasis from the bustling city.

The Renaissance Capital Hotel in Beijing is a modern, new hotel with a "wow" factor design, glass-walled bathrooms, and high-tech features in the rooms; it also offers a large fitness center with great views and a swimming pool. The hotel is located in the Central Business District near a subway station and a shopping mall, offering a convenient but quiet environment.

The Renaissance Beijing is located in a quieter part of Beijing, in a neighborhood setting outside the main downtown area, near embassies and a local flower market. It features a rooftop indoor pool and a health club, offering a safe haven and a cocoon-like atmosphere away from the crowds.

The Shangri-La Beijing is described as a "small oasis" with beautiful gardens, offering a peaceful retreat from the city's hustle and bustle. The hotel is located away from the city center, and some reviewers mention it feels isolated.

The Kerry Centre is a modern, luxurious hotel with amenities such as a gym, pool, spa, and a 24-hour bar, offering a relaxing and comfortable stay with great service. Rooms include complimentary water, fresh fruit, and access to a shopping mall with conveniences like dry cleaning and a supermarket.

The Shatan Hotel is located on a small, authentic hutong street behind the Forbidden City, offering a glimpse into local Beijing life with markets, food stalls, and shops. It is near Jingshan Park, known for providing incredible photos of the Forbidden City.

The Sofitel Wanda Beijing is a luxurious and modern hotel with spacious rooms, often equipped with amenities such as LCD TVs in the bathroom, rainfall showers, and comfortable beds with a pillow menu. Guests have noted the hotel's impressive lobby, pool, spa, and breakfast buffet, as well as its proximity to shopping centers and the subway.

The Soluxe Courtyard Hotel is located in the hutong, near the Guloudaije subway stop on Line 2, offering a traditional Chinese setting. It is situated in a quiet area with narrow streets, and within walking distance of lakes, the "bar street," and the drum and bell tower.

Somerset ZhongGuanCun offers apartments with central air conditioning, marble floors, and daily maid service. It features a pool and gym, and is located within walking distance of a supermarket and the subway line.

The Spring Garden Hotel is a small, quiet courtyard-style hotel with traditional Chinese decor located in a hutong, offering a unique cultural experience away from the tourist district. The hotel consists of 8 rooms surrounding courtyards, providing a peaceful and traditional ambiance with classic Chinese furniture.
I am sorry, but none of the reviews describe this hotel as providing an escape from reality. The reviews focus on its convenient location, cleanliness, and value.
The Swissotel Beijing offers a serene and calming atmosphere with scented oil at the elevator landings and quiet common areas. It also features a pool and health club.

Templeside Deluxe Hutong House is located in a traditional Beijing hutong neighborhood, offering an authentic experience of everyday life with local people; the hotel is set in an old family home with a central courtyard and clean, well-presented rooms.

The Aman at Summer Palace is located on the grounds of the Summer Palace and offers a private entrance. The hotel is designed to make guests feel like they are in old China, with a focus on incorporating local culture and creating a feel-at-home atmosphere.

The Emperor Hotel is a modern, funky boutique hotel with rooms named after Chinese Emperors, a rooftop bar with views of the Forbidden City, and uniquely designed rooms with open-concept bathrooms. The hotel is located in a quiet alley near the Forbidden City, offering a neighborhood feel away from tourist districts.

The Opposite House is a modern, minimalist hotel with spacious rooms featuring wooden floors and bathtubs, floor-to-ceiling windows, and high-tech amenities like electronic blinds, located in the Sanlitun area with convenient access to shopping, restaurants, and bars. The hotel offers unique design elements such as a lobby resembling a modern art gallery, a stainless steel swimming pool, and Maserati airport transfers, complemented by attentive staff and personalized service.

The Peninsula Palace is described as an "oasis" and a "relaxing haven" away from the noise and chaos of Beijing, with a serene atmosphere. It has luxuriously appointed rooms, mood lighting, and high-end shops in the lobby.

The Regent Beijing offers a luxurious retreat with spacious, well-appointed rooms, modern decor, and amenities like leg balms and aromatherapy foot rubs. The hotel also features a large pool, spa, and fitness center.

The Ritz-Carlton Beijing Financial Street is known for its modern decor, spacious rooms, and large bathrooms with TVs. It has a spa with jacuzzis and an indoor pool with a large screen showing movies.

The Ritz-Carlton Beijing is located in a modern, safe, and quiet area next to a high-end shopping mall, with traditionally decorated rooms, Bose sound systems, large flat-screen TVs, Bulgari amenities, and iPod docks. The hotel has a spa and pool and is close to the metro station.

The St. Regis Beijing is described as an oasis of calm and a refuge, with luxurious facilities including a pool, steam room, sauna, hot tub, cold plunge, and bowling alley. It is located in the embassy district, offering a quiet respite from the city's hustle.

The hotel has a glass-caged indoor pool with cabana beds, a spa that offers elaborate rituals, and rooms with automated window blinds. Some suites include features such as a TV that retracts up and down and an Osmi massage chair.

The Westin Beijing Financial Street offers a clean, fresh-smelling environment with comfortable beds, a luxurious pool area, and a well-equipped gym, providing a refuge from the city's chaos. Some rooms feature jacuzzi tubs and rainforest showers, and the hotel is located in a quiet area, offering a respite from the bustling city center.

The Tianlun Dynasty Hotel has a beautiful central atrium with palm trees, fountains, and soft music, offering a haven from Beijing street life. Rooms facing the atrium may experience noise from the music and dining area.

Located on a quiet hutong off Wangfujing Street, the hotel offers a peaceful escape from the busy city, with access to traditional Chinese alleyways. Some reviewers mention the hotel's location allows guests to experience local Beijing life away from the tourist hustle.

The Tiantan Hotel in Beijing offers well-appointed rooms with modern decor featuring marble/granite surfaces and rich wood furniture. It has multiple restaurants, business services, and is near the Temple of Heaven and Pearl Market.
The hotel is connected to the China World Trade building and complex which includes a high end mall. There is access to facilities at the nearby New World Hotel through an underground mall.

The Traders Upper East hotel is a modern, four-star business hotel located between the Beijing airport and the city center, featuring an iSpa, a gym open until 11 pm, and rooms with fully stocked minibars. The hotel offers services such as airport pick-up and prearranged taxis.
The hotel has a nightclub with scantily clad show girls/escorts and also has a tea house, spa, and travel office. It attempts to offer an immersive experience where you almost don't need to leave.
The hotel is located away from central Beijing, near university sites, and consists of multiple buildings. It has several restaurants, cafes and other services inside, as well as a bowling alley.
The hotel offers a swimming pool, spa, sauna, bowling alley, table tennis, gym, and massage services. Rooms feature large flat-screen TVs and the hotel is located near upscale shopping and dining.

Xinyuan Inn is located in a hutong and offers a more authentic Chinese experience with smaller, traditional rooms. It is within walking distance of many sights and has good bus access, though the subway is a 15-20 minute walk away.

The XiXI Youyi Hotel's main reception is located on Level 8, and the rooms are spacious; panoramic views of Beijing are available from corner rooms on the upper floors. A Korean restaurant with an all-you-can-eat buffet is located on Level 4.

The Xiyuan Hotel is located away from the city center, and one reviewer mentioned the hotel is near a quiet, tree-lined canal which offers opportunities for walking and running. The hotel also has a revolving restaurant on the top floor.

The hotel rooms are chic, stylish, and designed for functionality, with comfortable beds, crisp white sheets, a large walk-in shower, and aromatherapy and anti-allergen pillow options. The windows are set high in the wall and screened to keep things cool, and the hotel is located near a supermarket and market.

The Zhong An Hotel is located in a hutong, offering a glimpse into traditional Beijing life, but some found the alley leading to the hotel unappealing. It is close to the Beijing Railway Station, subway, and other transportation options.
